title: Repo sync
author: docs-bot
details: Updated documentation to clarify that external collaborators must have access to the upstream repository to be added to private forks in public GitHub (fpt/ghec).
Restructured OpenAPI schema files by moving `descriptionHTML` property to the end of endpoint definitions for consistency across GHES versions 3.14, 3.15, and 3.16.
summary:
- Updated documentation to clarify that external collaborators must have access to the upstream repository to be added to private forks in public GitHub (fpt/ghec).
- Restructured OpenAPI schema files by moving `descriptionHTML` property to the end of endpoint definitions for consistency across GHES versions 3.14, 3.15, and 3.16.
generated_title: Clarify fork collaborator permissions and standardize OpenAPI schema structure
commits: **c3dd1e9**: Update the documentation to state that outside collaborators must be added to the upstream repositories before they can be added to private forks (#56862) (by Deepu Issac Martin)
original_description:
This is an automated pull request to sync changes between the public and private repos.
Our bot will merge this pull request automatically.
To preserve continuity across repos, _do not squash_ this pull request.
raw_analysis:
### Summary
- Updated documentation to clarify that external collaborators must have access to the upstream repository to be added to private forks in public GitHub (fpt/ghec).
- Restructured OpenAPI schema files by moving `descriptionHTML` property to the end of endpoint definitions for consistency across GHES versions 3.14, 3.15, and 3.16.

### Title
Clarify fork collaborator permissions and standardize OpenAPI schema structure
